page.title: 14Bwlch-y-groes in 1955 (2)
page.content: Books were few,black and white with few pictures.When a person left home,their mother would give them a Bible.Most people were Welsh speaking.The newcomers spoke English. Workers wore clogs and every farm had a tractor,but only a few had milking machines.A cow and calf cost Â£100. Some farm-workers slept above the stable.There was no mains or hot water.Flagstones covered the floor.The chimneys were big.Culm a mixture of coal dust and clay,which burned with a blue flame gave heat.There was no electricity,only oil lamps.Oil cookers were used for cooking.Nearly everybody went to worship three times on a Sunday.Children did not play.All Sunday's work was done on Saturday. When they passed the 11+ they went to Cardigan Grammar.If they failed they stayed at the local school.
